The firing control circuitry uses SCR's to trigger pyrotechnic charges and is designed to limit the gate current and provide temperature stability. The simulator is packaged to resemble the magazine clip of the M16 and is designed to be reusable. The plastic expendable is designed to be fabricated in an automatic process, reducing cost.
</summary>

<summary>
The present invention relates to an air intake device of an internal combustion engine that improves engine performance by utilizing the dynamic effects of air flow. The device comprises a tank, a first pipe, and a second pipe, where the first and second passages are open to the intake passage at different locations. A valve is disposed in the first passage and is actuated by an actuator responsive to engine operating conditions. The second passage has a smaller cross-sectional area than the first passage and is preferably located upstream of the first passage. The provision of the narrow passage in the second pipe constitutes a resonator that absorbs intake noise. The resonator effect can be determined by the relationship between the frequency of the intake noise, the speed of sound, the cross-sectional area of the passage in the second pipe, the length of the passage, and the volume of the tank. The valve operation is controlled based on engine speed and load conditions, and the valve is preferably closed at any engine speed when the load is below a certain threshold. The valve is operated to create a new compound curve comprising the peak portions of the volumetric efficiency curves when the load is above the threshold. The engine load can be detected by the position of the throttle valve or other means, such as the vacuum level in the intake manifold.</summary>

<summary>

The invention is a two-part bracket assembly for mounting speakers or other equipment to a pole, flat surface, or other structure. The assembly consists of a stationary bracket and an adjustable bracket, which can be connected together to mount the equipment. The adjustable bracket can be rotated into a locked position and then snapped together with the stationary bracket using integrated hooks and tabs. The assembly is designed to be used by one person and can be installed on a variety of surfaces of different sizes. The invention includes a pole clamp assembly for mounting the bracket to a pole, which consists of a length of link chain with threaded J-hooks at each end. The J-hooks pass through slotted openings in the stationary bracket and pole adapters, and wing nuts are used to tension the chain. The assembly can be used to mount a speaker or other equipment to a pole or wall, and it provides 360 degrees of horizontal adjustment. The invention is designed to be resistant to weather, wind, and vibration, and it is suitable for use with a wide range of equipment, including loudspeakers, lighting, signage, and displays.

</summary>

<summary>

The invention relates to a burner for a heat utilizing appliance, which can be part of a system including a plurality of interchangeable or modular heat utilizing appliances. The burner has a combustion chamber enclosed by an outer wall surrounding a fuel holder, where air flows through the fuel holder to support initial combustion and around the fuel holder to support secondary combustion. A shroud surrounds the outer wall, establishing a flow path for tertiary combustion air and providing an external surface cool enough to avoid burns. The burner has legs holding the combustion chamber well above ground level and a pivotally coupled ash pan. A perforate food grate is pivotally coupled to the burner and is movable to a deployed position above the flame and to a stowed position to the side of the combustion chamber. The burner has manual couplings for removably coupling modular heat utilizing appliances to the burner. The modular heat utilizing appliances include closed and open cookers, a food smoker, a space heater, and a pyrolyzer. The burner can be provided with a fuel feed feature to enable renewing the fuel supply during operation. The invention also includes a pyrolyzer that can be used to pyrolyze carboniferous materials, such as vegetation, and recover vaporized products of pyrolysis as liquids or gases. The burner and pyrolyzer can be used together to supplement or eliminate the use of solid fuel in the burner.

</summary>

<summary>
The rotary internal combustion engine faces significant cooling challenges, particularly in the area surrounding the spark plugs, where uneven heating can cause housing distortion and thermal fatigue. The traditional in-line arrangement of spark plug bosses disrupts the cooling flow, leading to vapor film collection and reduced heat transfer. A new design, as described in the text, features staggered spark plug bosses with offset configurations to promote controlled flow and improve heat transfer coefficients. Tests have shown that this design can increase the heat transfer coefficient by up to 44% compared to the traditional in-line arrangement. The staggered configuration also reduces the temperature gradient across the gas side of the wall, making it a more efficient and effective cooling system.</summary>

<summary>
The invention is a method of minimizing flow disturbance caused by the closing and reopening of turbine control valves during periodic operational testing. The method uses control valve positions as feedback to maintain a constant total mass flow through parallel turbine inlet flow control valves. This is achieved by determining the flow difference between the N and N-1 valve conditions and applying it to the total flow demand of the N-1 valves. The method is implemented using a test compensation circuit that adjusts the flow through parallel control valves to minimize flow disturbance. The use of this method has been shown to reduce pressure excursions by 95% in a simulated turbine system.</summary>

<summary>The invention is a mixing valve for an aircraft cleaning apparatus that combines two fluids from separate sources into one mixture, allowing for continuous analog control of the proportional quantities of the fluids. The valve system includes a spool valve with a cylindrical portion and a series of cylindrical spools, which are slidably received within a bore, allowing for rotational movement and varying proportional mixtures of the fluids.</summary>

<summary>
The present invention relates to a method of compressing gas in a compressor station for a gas pipeline, particularly in permanent frost areas. The method includes compressing the gas to a higher pressure, cooling the gas by heat exchange, and expanding the gas to the desired exit pressure. The invention aims to reduce the required investments and operation risk. The method includes compressing the gas to an excess pressure above the desired exit pressure, cooling the compressed gas by heat exchange, and expanding the gas to the desired exit pressure. The expansion can be carried out by a valve or an expansion turbine. The expansion turbine can be coupled to the compressor to recover drive energy. The compressor station can be operated differently during the cold season by switching the valves to obtain a parallel operation of the compressors. The invention provides a better possibility of using the principal units of the compressor stations throughout the entire year. The effectiveness of the method under the conditions of summer operation has been demonstrated in an example, showing that the investment required for a plant according to the present invention is substantially lower than for a plant utilizing conventional re-cooling technology.</summary>

<summary>
The text describes a system for eliminating fasteners traditionally used for securing cooling fans to an enclosure. The system uses a cooling fan assembly with a motor carrier that includes mounting legs with resilient leg portions, which are designed to snap into place when the assembly is installed. The assembly is installed by applying a compressive and rotating force to the legs, which compress a spring member and move the legs into a series of openings in the panel. Once installed, the spring member remains compressed, urging the legs against the panel and preventing vibrational noise and forces from causing the legs to "back out" of their openings.</summary>

<summary>

Spacecraft structures require advanced lightweight and stiff composite materials, but these materials have low inherent damping, leading to high vibration levels that compromise instrument functionality. Conventional kinematic mounts have met with limited success in minimizing loads transmitted to instruments during launch. The present invention aims to provide kinematic mounts with novel damping features to protect instruments from potentially damaging flight loads. The invention modifies existing kinematic mounts by inserting vibration damping materials into the mounts, which dissipate energy and reduce high-energy disturbances to the instrument. Two embodiments of the damper design are presented: a spherical damper and a cylindrical slot damper. The spherical damper uses a viscoelastic material to dissipate energy through shearing deformation, while the cylindrical slot damper uses o-rings to induce compression/tension in the viscoelastic material. The invention also proposes a center-of-gravity mounting system, where the six suspension vibration modes of the instrument become approximately uncoupled, providing improved performance in applications with dynamic disturbances. The present invention enables the use of damped kinematic mounts to protect instruments from potentially damaging flight loads, achieving significant performance improvements over existing designs.</summary>

<summary>
The invention is a novel and improved clutch unit that overcomes the disadvantages of previously known constructions, particularly in large size power transmission requirements. The clutch unit utilizes hydraulic fluid for the dual purpose of retracting the plate actuating means to reduce residual drag and as a coolant for the clutch discs. The unit also features a segmental disc arrangement that minimizes the deleterious effects of heat on the discs and allows for convenient inspections and replacement of disc segments without requiring total disassembly of the unit.</summary>

<summary>
The invention describes a combined engine system that includes a combustion cylinder and an expansion cylinder, where the expansion cylinder receives hot exhaust gas from the combustion cylinder and also receives a source of water that is expanded into steam by the hot exhaust gas to create further drive for a common crankshaft. The system aims to maximize thermal-to-mechanical energy extraction and minimize heat loss to the environment, potentially eliminating the need for a radiator. The system also includes features such as water recovery, catalytic conversion, and gear reduction to optimize performance and efficiency.</summary>

<summary>

The invention concerns the fabrication of plates or blanks of coated steel intended to be welded and then heat treated to obtain parts having good mechanical characteristics and good corrosion resistance. The current method of fabrication has difficulties when welding coated steel blanks, as a portion of the initial surface pre-coating is transferred into the molten area created by the welding operation. This leads to the formation of intermetallic areas, which tend to be the site of onset of rupture under static or dynamic conditions. The present invention provides a plate consisting of a steel substrate and a precoat consisting of a layer of intermetallic alloy in contact with the substrate, topped by a layer of metal alloy. The metal alloy layer is removed from at least one precoated face of the plate, preferably by brushing or laser ablation, to create an area with no metal alloy layer. The width of the area from which the metal alloy layer has been removed must be adjusted to enable welding with no introduction of any element of the precoat into the molten area and sufficient corrosion resistance of the welded assembly after subsequent alloying and austenizing heat treatment. The invention also provides a method of fabricating a precoated steel plate and a part fabrication method, as well as a use of a plate, blank or part according to the invention for the fabrication of structural or safety parts for motorized terrestrial automotive vehicles. The invention has been demonstrated to achieve good ductility of the welded joint after treatment and good corrosion resistance.

</summary>

<summary>

The present invention is a supervisory control and data acquisition (SCADA) system for remote control of a mobile structure that recovers energy from an offshore marine environment. The system optimizes energy extraction by accounting for data from weather observations and sensors on the mobile structure, and relates these data points to performance models for the mobile structure. The SCADA system includes computer servers that gather data through various means, such as GPS systems, weather satellite systems, and geographic and weather data resources. The system runs Human Machine Interface (HMI) secure software applications that communicate with microprocessor systems running client software with a Graphical User Interface (GUI) to allow remote humans to interact and choose mission critical navigation plans. The system can guide navigation of vessels for logistics-only purposes past severe weather patterns. The SCADA system includes a control and communications microprocessor system on the mobile structure, and a central service facility with a microprocessor system running secure server software applications and workstations running secure client software applications. The system uses various network standards and protocols, such as TCP/IP, to communicate between the server, workstations, and PLCs.

</summary>

<summary>
The invention relates to a rolling body guide cage produced from a ring element composed of at least two flat material ring segments joined together in succession in the circumferential direction. The ring segments are preferably punched out from a sheet metal material and welded together in a production step that precedes the formation of the axial profiling. The invention aims to reduce production costs by minimizing cutting waste and is particularly advantageous for the manufacture of rolling body guide cages with an internal diameter of more than 140 mm. The ring segments can be joined together in various ways, including by welding, and can be formed with a 120° segment angle to minimize the number of weld points required.</summary>

<summary>

The document describes a system for providing customer service in a telecommunications network. The system uses global satellite positioning to facilitate processing and transmission of information associated with telecommunications service locations. The system includes a technician server that directs a GPS system to obtain coordinates for a customer service location. The GPS system transmits the coordinates to the technician server, which updates a database with the coordinates. The system also includes a mapping system that provides travel directions to a service technician between customer service locations. The mapping system receives "from" and "to" coordinates from the technician server and generates driving directions. The system uses a dispatch system to receive and process information related to service required at customer service locations. The dispatch system communicates with the technician server to process and transmit information related to actions to be performed at a customer service location. The system also includes an address guide system that stores universal type address information and a customer record system that stores customer-related information. The system uses a protocol server to process communications from the technician server and other systems.

</summary>

<summary>
The invention provides a system for compensating electromagnetic interfering fields, which has two real triaxial magnetic field sensors, three pairs of compensation coils, and one control unit. The system can compensate both homogeneous and inhomogeneous magnetic fields. The control unit combines the output signals of the two real sensors to three output signals of a virtual sensor using a freely definable averaging algorithm. The algorithm used by the control system can be described as O=L·Ω(M·S), where O are the control signals, L is a 6×6 matrix, Ω is the control algorithm, M is the 6×6 matrix describing the averaging, and S is the 6×1 matrix of the output signals of the real sensors. The system can also be used to equalize potentially arising feedback effects in the case of using two magnetic field compensation systems in immediate vicinity. A 6×6 back coupling matrix C is used to computationally eliminate the parts of the signals, which are crosstalks from an output signal to a virtual signal. The system can be used in various applications, such as in scanning electron microscopes (SEM) and in connection with imaging systems using magnetic fields.

<summary>

The invention relates to a method for investigating a sample derived from a biological source using Coherent Anti-Stokes Raman Scattering (CARS) microscopy. The method involves furnishing at least one resonance site in the sample by means of a bioorthogonal reaction of an intrinsic chemical structure of the sample with at least one reaction partner. Bioorthogonal reactions are chemical reactions that can proceed in living systems without interfering with natural processes. The invention allows for the introduction of resonance sites into a sample that inherently does not possess them, or in which the resonance sites do not exhibit the desired localization or specificity. This is achieved by coupling a reaction partner to the intrinsic chemical structure of the sample, which can be done in one or two stages. The invention enables dedicated detection of target sites in any samples, such as cells, without negatively affecting biochemical processes. The method can be used in combination with CARS microscopy to produce images of the sample with high spatial resolution.

</summary>

<summary>The present invention provides a system for assessing segmentations from various sources in radiation therapy, allowing for comparison of segmentations from different clinicians or software systems. The system uses a digitized virtual model of the patient's anatomy and a metric method to evaluate the quality of the segmentations, providing a quantitative evaluation of the comparison of the two segmentations.</summary>

<summary>
The invention relates to a method and apparatus for accelerating the effective subtraction operation in a floating point unit. The method involves determining the difference between a subset of the operand exponent arguments, which provides a result prior to the determination of the complete difference between the operand exponent arguments. Based on the subset difference, a difference in the operand fractions is determined during the time that the difference between the complete operand exponent arguments is being calculated. The apparatus includes a detection and logic unit, a shift and selection logic unit, and a subtraction unit, which work together to accelerate the effective subtraction operation. The invention accelerates the computation of the final fraction result by initiating the operation requiring a calculation prior to the determination of the difference between the complete operand arguments.</summary>

<summary>
The invention aims to reduce mislabeling of specimen vials in medical facilities. The method involves storing machine-readable codes on patient ID bands, orders, specimen-taker IDs, and specimen containers. A computer system reads and stores these codes in a relational manner, ensuring that the correct specimen is collected and labeled. The system generates a signal to acquire a specimen and places it in the correct container. The lab receiving the specimen has access to the order and label information stored in the database, eliminating the need for further paperwork or labels. The system also includes features such as expiration date checks for specimen containers and alerts for out-of-date containers. The invention provides a failsafe, zero-defect process for identifying and processing patient specimen samples, eliminating the need for vial labels and associated costs.</summary>

<summary>
The invention is a voice-activated distance measuring device that provides golfers with distance and other information on a golf course. The device uses GPS technology and voice recognition software to provide verbal feedback to the user. It can be incorporated into an article of clothing, such as a hat or visor, and uses commercially available GPS data to measure distances and other golf course parameters. The device can also accept verbal or other data input and memorize it to predict golf course user strategy, club selection, and other golf player needs. The device may use a bone conductance vibration sensor to receive audio from the user, which is superior to conventional microphones in rejecting external noise. The device can be expanded to include its use in other portable applications, such as hiking, surveying, and hunting. The device may also be connected to a separate personal computer for uploading and downloading data, and for facilitating various detailed functions such as graphical display of the user's score and plot of all ball trajectories.</summary>

<summary>

The present invention relates to a design rule checking system and method for integrated circuits (ICs) that includes both logic and memory circuits. The system and method eliminate false errors caused by design rule checking tools examining regions that are not subject to the same design rules. A customized design rule is created for each different type of region on the chip by modifying a standard set of logic rules to reflect the needs of particular regions. The system checks different regions with different design rules, ensuring that design rules are accurately resolved for a system on chip integrated circuit design. The invention can be applied to any mask pattern database, including one having no memory blocks, or even multiple types of memory blocks. The system and method provide a more accurate and efficient design verification tool that eliminates the need for manual checking and false errors.

</summary>

<summary>The invention described in the source document is a waveguide hologram (WGH) illuminator that provides controlled and efficient illumination for objects such as holograms and spatial light modulators. The WGH illuminator has several advantages over conventional illumination systems, including reduced volume, high diffraction efficiency, and the absence of stray light, but also has some limitations and potential solutions to these issues.</summary>

<summary>

The invention relates to a method and apparatus for testing squirrel cage rotors of induction motors to obtain resistance, reactance, and effective electrical skew. The test apparatus includes a test head with exciting means for magnetizing the rotor, voltage sensing means for generating a voltage signal, and current sensing means for generating a current signal. The processing means determines the resistance and reactance of the rotor from the voltage and current signals. The skew sensing means senses the effective electrical skew of the rotor and generates an effective skew signal. The test apparatus is designed for non-destructive testing and can be used to detect defects in the rotor. The apparatus includes a data acquisition and processing system that controls the acquisition of test data and processes the data to produce useful test results. The system includes a data processor and a control processor that work together to determine the resistance, reactance, and effective skew of the rotor. The control processor also controls the sequence of events during a test and generates a pass/fail indication based on the test results. The apparatus is designed to be efficient and cost-effective, allowing for the testing of multiple rotors in a short amount of time.

</summary>

<summary>
The text describes a method for securing a mobile device by granting access to native resources of an operating system in response to validating a digital certificate associated with a managed library. The method involves authorizing a request to access a native system resource through a managed library, verifying the digital certificate associated with the managed library, and sending a request to access the native system resource to a runtime host. The runtime host is effectuated by native instructions and can access the native system resource. The method also involves verifying managed metadata associated with an executable, inspecting the managed metadata at runtime to determine that the executable includes type-safe code, and storing the verified executable in a digitally signed container. The container can be transmitted to a mobile device, where it can be purchased and downloaded. The method ensures that only trusted code can access native resources and prevents malicious code from accessing sensitive information on the mobile device.</summary>

<summary>
The invention relates to an improved identification card containing an internal antenna and integrated circuit chip laminated between two protective, non-rigid layers onto which artwork may be printed. The card is designed to protect the electronic components from damage and is made with a unique structure that disseminates external forces over a broad area of compliant layers. The identification card comprises a core layer, a bottom sheet, an antenna, an IC chip, and two laminate layers. The core layer is made of a silica-filled polyolefin and is pre-shrunk to prevent shrinking problems during printing and attachment of electronic components. The card is manufactured by printing fixed indicia on the core layer and bottom sheet, attaching an antenna and IC chip, and then laminating the layers together using a nip-roll lamination process. The resulting card is then imprinted with personal information and security features can be added to the top surface of the card.</summary>

<summary>
The invention relates to a novel way of implementing a queue, particularly a FIFO-type queue, in a memory. The solution is intended for use in connection with functional memories, where updates are carried out by copying the path from the root of a tree-shaped structure to the point of updating. A tree-shaped data structure is used to implement the queue, where nodes have a given maximum size and leaf nodes are at the same level. The tree meets two conditions: all leaf nodes are at the same level, and all internal nodes are full except for the nodes on the edges of the tree. The invention reduces the amount of required copying in a functional structure, making updates faster and less space-consuming. A header node is added to the data structure to make updates even faster and less space-consuming. The header node can be inverted in constant time and space, allowing the queue to be used as a double-ended queue. The invention can be modified within the scope of the inventive idea disclosed in the appended claims.</summary>

<summary>
The invention relates to electrically programmable random access memory (EPROM) devices that can be manufactured using existing integrated circuit (IC) technologies, such as DRAM or logic circuits. The EPROM devices of the present invention utilize DRAM storage capacitors as coupling capacitors, allowing for the manufacture of EPROM devices using existing DRAM manufacture technologies. The EPROM devices have several advantages, including the ability to operate at lower voltages and the potential for smaller area and higher performance. Another type of EPROM device, called SEPROM, uses the damages caused by electrical stresses on common transistors to store data, allowing for the manufacture of EPROM devices using any IC technology. SEPROM devices have several advantages, including the ability to store large numbers of data at low cost and the potential for security applications. </summary>

<summary>

The invention relates to a method of determining feedback gain for feedback control systems, particularly for automatic guidance vehicles (AGVs). The method involves provisionally determining a feedback gain, executing feedback control, detecting an error, calculating an evaluation value, and repeating the process with a new feedback gain value. The evaluation value is used to determine the feedback gain that provides a suitable evaluation value. The method is particularly useful for determining the proportional, integral, and differential gains. The proportional gain influences the stability of control, the integral gain affects the accuracy of control, and the differential gain affects the response of control. The method uses evaluation functions to evaluate the influence of each gain on the control system. The evaluation functions are suited for evaluating the optimum values of the gains and can be used to determine the gains quickly and accurately.

</summary>

<summary>
The invention relates to zoom lenses with increased relative aperture and good optical performance over the entire zooming range, while minimizing the physical size and total length. The zoom lens comprises five lens units, with the fourth unit having a positive lens to make the diverging light beam almost parallel, and the fifth unit having an image-forming function with six lenses of positive, negative, positive, negative, positive, and positive powers. The lens design satisfies several conditions to achieve good aberration correction, including inequalities for the refractive power of the fourth and fifth lens units. The invention has achieved a great advance in reducing the size of the zoom lens, with a total length of 9.13φA to 9.19φA. The zoom lens is suited to photographic cameras or video cameras, particularly the 8mm video camera with a 1/2 inch image pickup tube. </summary>

<summary>
The invention relates to a method and device for detecting elementary particles such as protons, ions, electrons, neutrons, photons, or the like. The method involves generating a charge pulse in a detector when a particle passes through it, converting the charge pulse into an electric signal, and amplifying the signal. The device includes a detector, a first fast amplifier for amplifying individual signals, and a second slow amplifier for integrating signals. The invention enables both the detection of individual particles and the integration of count rates without knowing in advance the expected count or signal rates.
</summary>

<summary>

The invention is an automatic spin checking apparatus for driven disc assemblies used in friction clutches. The apparatus includes a stationary ring and a movable ring that can be moved towards each other to frictionally engage the driven disc assembly. A torque motor is used to exert a predetermined torque on the driven disc assembly, and a servo motor is used to move the movable ring away from the stationary ring. The apparatus includes a microprocessor that controls the operation of the motors and measures the distance between the rings and the rotation of the driven disc assembly. The microprocessor compares the measurements to standard values to determine if the driven disc assembly is within specified tolerances. If the assembly is within tolerances, the microprocessor actuates the servo motor to move the movable ring away from the stationary ring, allowing the assembly to be removed. If the assembly is not within tolerances, the microprocessor actuates the servo motor to halt movement and generates a visible alert to the operator. The apparatus can store measurements for statistical process control.

</summary>

<summary>

The invention relates to face age-estimation and methods, systems, and software therefor. Face recognition is a challenging task in computer vision due to large variations in human faces, and face age-estimation is even more difficult. The invention aims to provide an accurate, efficient, uncooperative, and cost-effective solution to the problem of face age-estimation. A contourlet appearance model (CAM) algorithm is used to extract feature vectors from face images, which are then used to train an age classifier and two aging functions. The age classifier is used to distinguish between youths and adults, and the aging functions are used to estimate the age of a face based on the classification result. The invention also includes a machine-readable storage medium containing machine-executable instructions for performing the face age-estimation method. A computing system is also disclosed, which includes a processor, memory, storage device, input device, network interface device, video display adapter, and peripheral output devices. The computing system can be used to implement the face age-estimation method and store the estimated age results. The invention provides a novel approach to face age-estimation using a contourlet appearance model and support vector machines.

</summary>

<summary>
The invention relates to a matrix display device for displaying two merged images with different definitions. The device comprises a controller and a matrix of pixels organized in a mosaic of identical arrangements of pixels. Each arrangement can be formed by a square of four pixels, with a first number of pixels receiving light intensity signals associated with the first image and the other pixels receiving light intensity signals associated with the second image or a combination of the two. The controller can apply an attenuation function to the light intensity signals to correct the display of the first image and enhance the visibility of the second image. The device can be configured to display a plurality of combined images, with arrangements of pixels dedicated to different images.

</summary>

<summary>
The invention relates to a mobile identification transmitter for activating a security system of a motor vehicle, which has an enlarged functionality and a simple design. The transmitter has a housing with a receptacle that can hold a payment element, which can be removed from the receptacle to prevent unauthorized payment actions. The payment element can be brought into data communication with an electronic payment system, and the transmitter can communicate with the security system of the motor vehicle in both the normal and secure states.
</summary>

<summary>
The disclosed embodiments address the issue of inconsistent image quality in an imaging device after a long period of inactivity. The embodiments include a method for charging a toner used in an imaging device, which determines one or more periods of inactivity of the imaging device and charges the toner to a predetermined level based on the determined period of inactivity. The embodiments also include an apparatus for charging a developer in an imaging device, which includes an inactivity determining section and a charging section. The inactivity determining section determines one or more periods of inactivity of the imaging device, and the charging section charges the toner to a predetermined level.
</summary>

The disclosed embodiments further describe a structure of an exemplary printing device, which includes a photoreceptor belt, a charging station, an imaging and exposure station, a developer station, a transfer station, a fusing station, and a cleaning station. The embodiments also describe an intelligent toner charging system, which includes an inactivity determining section, a predicting section, a measuring section, a calculating section, an updating section, a storing section, a charging section, and a performing section. The intelligent toner charging system determines the inactivity of the machine, predicts the next user usage, measures the TC sensor, calculates the decay of the tribo charge, updates the information, stores the information, charges the toner, and performs a printing operation.

<summary>The present invention relates to a rotary magnetic head type apparatus that permits independent and precise regulation of bias currents supplied to plural MR heads mounted on a rotary drum in a simple structure. The invention enables the output signals of the MR heads to be transmitted by a single channel rotary transformer and the control data to be transmitted with priority over other control data.</summary>

<summary>

The invention is concerned with locating and tracing concealed elongated conductive objects, such as pipes or cables, especially when a second object is adjacent to the first. The prior art uses two techniques: a passive technique employing a gradiometer and an active technique using a transmitter and receiver. However, when two cables are present, running generally in the same direction, tracing of the desired cable becomes difficult. The present invention alleviates this problem by employing a transmitter with a pair of antennae that generate corresponding magnetic fields, inducing distinguishable currents in the cables. The system produces two distinct output signal nulls over respective cables, allowing for easier and more accurate location and tracing. The transmitter is optimally positioned relative to the cables, and the receiver will normally be swept back and forth across both cables to facilitate the desired positioning of the transmitter. The currents in the cables are made distinguishable by using different carrier frequencies, amplitude-modulating the same carrier frequency with different frequencies, or pulsing the currents at different repetition rates. The invention is especially useful in environments where the horizontal separation between the cables is related to the depth of the cable to be located and traced. The system can be optimized by adjusting a threshold sensitivity control and can be modified to use only one antennae when only a single cable is present.</summary>

<summary>
The invention is an apparatus for interfacing a speaker phone with a telephone network to permit hands-free automatic answering and communication. The apparatus includes a source of power, selective switch means, and a coupler for automatically coupling the telephone network to the speaker device to receive incoming telephone calls on the speaker device. The apparatus also includes a timer for controlling the length of time of such interconnection and a bypass switch for bypassing the timer. The invention provides a simplified, portable, and readily connectable automatic answering service for automatically interconnecting incoming telephone calls with a speaker phone to permit two-way communication by the recipient with the use of a minimum amount of circuitry and with a simple connection. 
</summary>

<summary>

The present invention relates to the field of optical fiber communications, specifically to system network design and incorporation of branch powered amplification within such networks. The invention aims to reduce or eliminate the need for undersea optical repeaters in trunk and branch ring networks. A system for reducing or eliminating undersea optical repeaters is disclosed, which replaces repeaters with remotely pumped optical amplifiers and remotely supplies energy to those optical amplifiers over the same branch cables that also distribute communications signals. The system consists of a hub assembly with remote pumping, a hub assembly without remote pumping, and one or more branch assemblies. Each branch assembly includes a cable station, a light emitting power source, a branch fiber optic cable, and a branching unit. The light emitting power source is used to supply energy to an optical amplifier, which amplifies attenuated optical signals. The system allows for signal amplification without the use of conventional optical repeaters, reducing the cost of undersea communications networks. The invention also provides a means of reducing the capital costs and operating and maintenance costs of communications networks.

</summary>

<summary>

The invention is a cover plate device for wall-mounted electrical wiring devices that can be quickly and easily installed and removed. The device consists of two parts: an attachment member and a cover plate member. The attachment member is installed over a wiring device and mounted to it using available fasteners, while the cover plate member has no fastener holes and is designed to fit over the attachment member and the wiring device. The cover plate member has a ridge and saw-tooth shaped racks on its inner surfaces that engage with latching pawls on the attachment member, allowing for independent operation and flexibility in accommodating irregularities in the wall. The device can be used to cover a single wiring device or multiple devices in a ganged box arrangement, and can be customized to fit different types and numbers of wiring devices. The invention provides a finished look without exposed fasteners and can be easily removed and reinstalled.

</summary>

<summary>
The invention is a collapsible light-shielding device for a screen, intended for use with television sets, monitors, and other displaying screens. The device consists of a number of annular strips that are concentrically nested and can be slid over one another to extend or retract the device. The strips are designed to be fixed in front of the displaying screen and can be attached using Velcro or other fastening methods. The device is designed to be compact and can be folded around the displaying screen when not in use, allowing for easy storage and transportation. The strips can be made of solid material or plate material with integrated hooks and locking elements, and can be produced using injection-molding or bending techniques. The device provides a flexible and adjustable solution for blocking light reflections on the screen, allowing for viewing from various angles.</summary>

<summary>
The invention relates to automated speech technologies that provide an indication to a speaker when their rate of speech is likely to be greater than a rate that a listener can comprehend. The invention includes a device that monitors the rate of speech during a discourse and provides a warning to the speaker to slow down when the rate is too rapid. The device can be a wearable device, such as a smartphone, that can vibrate, blink, produce speech, or display a message to notify the speaker. The device can also include a language detector, a speech clarity processor, and a comprehension comparator to determine the language being spoken, the clarity of the speech, and the listener's proficiency with the language. The device can use various techniques to determine the listener's proficiency, including speech analysis, video analysis, and RFID tags. The device can also use a speaking table to enumerate languages spoken by a speaker and relate a clarity value to each spoken language. The invention includes a method for automatically notifying a speaker to decrease their speaking rate, which involves detecting the language being spoken, determining the listener's proficiency, and comparing the speaker's rate to a threshold. The method can also include adjusting the speaking rate based on the clarity of the speech and providing an option to shift the conversation language to an alternative language shared by the speaker and listener.</summary>

<summary>
The invention is a device for the optical recording of rapid processes with a TV camera, which allows for a higher picture sequence frequency. The device comprises means for deviating and suppressing the beam, a cyclic line counter, and a sawtooth generator. The cyclic line counter counts the line pulses and supplies an end-of-count pulse after a certain number of pulses, which is used to suppress the beam. The sawtooth generator is synchronized with the output pulses of the counter and controls the vertical deviation of the beam. The device can be modified to increase the picture sequence frequency by a factor of 40 compared to a conventional TV half-frame. The spatial resolution of the picture suffers only in the vertical direction, while the resolution in the line direction remains high. The video signals can be digitized and stored in a data processing device for analysis. The device can be adjusted to determine the optimal time resolution with the best possible spatial resolution. The device can also be used to record IR, UV, or X-ray pictures. The invention allows for the analysis of rapid processes that were previously difficult or expensive to record, such as those requiring film cameras with rotating mirrors.
</summary>

<summary>
The present invention relates to multimedia communications and provides a technique for handling multimedia calls with clients having legacy phones and services. The invention integrates voice calls with multimedia sessions as a blended call, allowing existing customer premises equipment and network elements to be used to support multimedia capabilities. A telephony server and a multimedia server work together to manage blended calls, with the multimedia server controlling the signaling paths and bearer paths of the call components. The invention uses a Session Initiation Protocol (SIP) configuration and can be integrated with an Intelligent Network (IN) for basic call disposition handling. The blender software, which is part of the multimedia server, initiates parallel voice and multimedia components with the customer premises equipment and keeps control of the signaling paths. The invention allows for backwards compatibility with existing network systems and protocols, making it suitable for use in a variety of network environments.</summary>

<summary>The present invention is a content synchronization framework that allows connected devices to perform contextual synchronization over various communication network topologies, making use of transport optimization such as data compression to save bandwidth and time. The framework provides a central reference point, where each communicating device synchronizes to the content determined by this central reference point, and supports both synchronous and asynchronous interaction between the central reference point and connected devices or appliances.</summary>

<summary>The present invention provides a system and method for facilitating communication between a finder of a lost object and its owner, allowing the finder to anonymously contact the owner through a virtual locale, such as a website or instant messaging screenname, associated with the object. The system includes a database that stores associations between owner contact information and unique IDs, and a module that forwards finder communications to the owner's email address or other contact information, while maintaining the finder's anonymity.</summary>

<summary>
The foil electron multiplier is a new design of electron multipliers that uses a sequential series of thin foils in an evacuated enclosure to multiply electrons in a series of transmission stages. This design has several advantages over conventional electron multipliers, including higher gain per multiplication stage, simplicity of fabrication, lower cost of fabrication, ability to cover a larger area, and intrinsic rejection of ion feedback at each stage. The foil electron multiplier can be used in photomultiplier tubes and particle detectors, and its gain can be modeled using equations that describe the electron multiplication process.
</summary>

<summary>
The 3-D Phenomenoscope invention is a system that allows any motion picture to be viewed with the visual effect of 3-dimensions. It uses the Pulfrich effect, which creates a 3-D illusion by delaying one eye's image by a fraction of a second. The invention consists of viewing glasses with individually controllable lenses, a digital photo sensor, and a computer processor that processes the digital image and calculates synchronization signals to control the lenses. The lenses can take three different states: clear-clear, clear-darkened, and darkened-clear. The invention uses an intensity edge map algorithm to detect lateral movement in the motion picture and identify synchronization events. The algorithm processes successive frames of the motion picture, identifies vertical edges, and compares them to determine the direction of motion. The invention can be used to view any motion picture, regardless of the format or medium, and can be controlled in real-time by an intelligent processor packaged with the glasses.</summary>

<summary>
The present invention relates to an apparatus and method for dicing semiconductor wafers using pressure to mechanically separate individual die from the wafer. The current method of using a wafer saw has several problems, including slow processing time, maintenance issues, and chipping of the wafer. The invention aims to overcome these issues by using pressure to singulate the die. The method involves forming trenches along the scribe lines on the wafer and applying mechanical pressure to cause a "clean break" along the trenches. The trenches are formed by applying a photo resist layer, patterning it, and etching the wafer. The wafer is then back-grinded to reduce its thickness, and an adhesive tape is applied to the back surface. The wafer is placed on a soft pad, and pressure is applied to the back surface to cause the wafer to break along the trenches. The ring used to hold the wafer in place during singulation has the same general shape as the wafer and is placed around its circumference. The pressure applied can be in the X and Y directions or in a circular motion. The invention can be used for any sized wafer or type of die, and the trenches can be formed by etching or partially cutting the wafer using a wafer saw.</summary>

<summary>

The present invention relates to a field emission display (FED) device having a protection structure to prevent burn-out damage to field emission elements. The protection structure includes at least one reduction plate or electrode that deflects the discharge path of ionized gases away from the cathode. The reduction plate or electrode is typically provided on the cathode and is electrically connected to a bias voltage source that applies a negative voltage to attract positive nitrogen and oxygen ions. This prevents the ions from contacting the cathode and inducing surging of an excessive electrical current. The reduction plates or electrodes can be formed in various shapes, including elongated and parallel, meshwork-shaped, or net-shaped configurations. In one embodiment, multiple reduction plates or electrodes are interspersed among field emission elements on the cathode. The FED device includes a cathode, an anode, and an operating voltage source that establishes an electric field between the cathode and the anode. High-energy electrons emitted from the field emission elements strike molecular nitrogen and oxygen, forming positive nitrogen and oxygen ions. The reduction plates or electrodes deflect the ions away from the cathode, preventing burn-out damage to the field emission elements.

</summary>

<summary>
The present invention relates to an image sensor that includes multiple imaging planes. The image sensor is formed on a semiconductor substrate with opposed major surfaces and opposed edges, one of which is receptive to light. The image sensor includes an image sensor element formed in the substrate adjacent to the edge, which includes a charge collection and transfer means and an image sensing region. The substrate has a highly doped bottom layer and a more lightly doped upper layer, with three columns of image sensor elements formed in the substrate. The image sensor can be used to image in a plurality of planes, including the top surface and two edge surfaces, and can be used in various applications such as simultaneous imaging of two opposing surfaces. The invention can be formed using processing techniques compatible with other types of image sensors, making it easily incorporated into various types of known image sensors.</summary>

<summary>The invention describes a method for transferring network administrative functions from a master device to a slave device in a home network, allowing the master device to enter a power management state and minimizing total power consumption while ensuring that the administrative functions are performed by another device.</summary>

The original text describes a home network system where devices can serve as either a network master node or a network slave node. The network master node performs network administrative functions and can transfer these functions to a network slave node when it enters a power management state, allowing the network to continue functioning while minimizing power consumption.

<summary>
The invention relates to an antenna array for measuring the direction of propagation of electromagnetic radiation. The array consists of at least four antennae spaced to provide at least two equi-spaced linear triplets perpendicular to a ground plane. Each triplet has a unique spacing and height of the central antenna above the ground plane. The array uses radio interferometric techniques to obtain information signals from each antenna, which are then combined to provide a quotient signal that is a function of the elevation angle but not the ground reflection coefficient. The quotient signal is used to measure the elevation angle, and the array can operate in either receive or transmit mode. In the transmit mode, the transmitted signal from each antenna is coded so that it can be identified in a remote receiver. The array can be used for various applications, including monitoring the height of aircraft approaching to land. The invention provides unambiguous angle measurement up to about 7 degrees and measurement accuracy and resolution of the order +/-0.05 degrees from 3 degrees to the lowest angle possible.</summary>

<summary>
The invention relates to a high-intensity, thermal, efficient incandescent lamp with a liquid-tight seal. The conventional subminiature lamps have a glass envelope supported by a metal sleeve, but the adhesive used to bond the glass envelope to the sleeve breaks down due to thermal cycling and exposure to cleaning or sterilizing liquids. The invention proposes a polymeric seal support that directly surrounds and is in compression contact with the glass envelope, providing a longer bulb life and protection from burns. The polymeric seal support is made of a high-temperature polymer, such as a fluoroelastomer, which can withstand high temperatures and is chemically non-reactive. The seal supported subminiature lamp assembly has a liquid-tight seal, eliminating the need for adhesive or cement, and provides a longer seal length and compression level, reducing the risk of seal failure. The invention can be applied to any situation where insulation, high heat degradation resistance, solvent and chemical resistance is required, including medical subminiature lamps.</summary>

<summary>

The text describes a Generalized Decision Feedback Equalizer (GDFE) based precoder for multi-user multiple-input multiple-output (MU-MIMO) wireless systems. The GDFE Precoder is a technique that provides the optimal capacity solution for MU-MIMO systems but has a high computational cost. The text proposes a method to compute the GDFE Precoder matrices without requiring knowledge of the covariance matrix (Szz) corresponding to "Least Favorable Noise." The method involves computing the filter matrix C using one of several alternative formulas and then computing the transmit filter matrix B, the feedforward filter matrix F, and the interference pre-cancellation matrix G. The text also provides numerical examples to illustrate the computation of the GDFE Precoder matrices using different methods. The examples show that the proposed method can significantly reduce the computational cost while resulting in no capacity loss. The GDFE Precoder is suitable for improving the performance of various MU-MIMO wireless systems, including future "4G" cellular networks.</summary>

<summary>
The invention relates to a heat-dissipating device and a housing thereof, specifically an axial fan with an increased intake airflow rate without modifying the assembling conditions with other elements. The fan is designed to enhance the heat-dissipating performance by enlarging the intake airflow area of the housing. The housing includes an outer frame with a passage for guiding air streams, and the sidewall of the passage extends radially outwards to enlarge the intake area. The design allows the dimension of the blade of the impeller to be enlarged along with the outward extension of the sidewall of the housing. The inclined portion of the sidewall of the housing can be formed to enlarge the intake airflow area and reduce noises. The heat-dissipating device can be used with a heat sink to enhance the heat-dissipating efficiency. The invention can be applied to various systems, including a system casing with electrical elements mounted. The design of the inclined portion of the sidewall of the passage can guide air streams toward the central portion of the heat sink having the highest temperature, enhancing the heat-dissipating effects of the fan.</summary>

<summary>
The present invention relates to an electroluminescent display panel that can display different colors according to the situation without using an intermediate electrode. The panel is composed of various layers laminated on a glass substrate, including a first electrode layer, a first insulation layer, a first luminescent layer, a second luminescent layer, a second insulation layer, and a second electrode layer. The first luminescent layer emits light including no visible red light components, and the second luminescent layer emits light including visible red light components. By changing the driving voltage, the display panel can change the display color from green to lemon, and the color purity can be also changed by selecting the width of the second luminescent layer or the thickness of the insulation layer.</summary>

<summary>
The invention relates to a communications terminal for Internet/network telephony, which comprises audio means, converting means, and protocol means. The terminal establishes a wireless connection to a connecting unit, which establishes a connection to a network and/or the Internet, allowing for telephony via the Internet. The system also comprises a service server connected to the Internet/network, which handles and controls the connection between users and provides additional services and functionalities. The method for Internet/network telephony involves reproducing sound, converting signals, handling communication, and establishing a wireless connection to a connecting unit.
</summary>

<summary>
The invention describes a method for fabricating a structure useful in semiconductor circuitry by growing a buffer layer of non-Pb/Bi-containing high-dielectric constant oxide directly or indirectly on a semiconductor substrate, and depositing a Pb/Bi-containing high-dielectric constant oxide on the buffer layer. A germanium layer is preferably used as a buffer layer between high-dielectric oxides and Si or metal to reduce reactivity and enhance epitaxy. The use of a second ferroelectric layer as a chemical buffer layer is also described, which can act as a diffusion barrier and improve the properties of the ferroelectric material. The invention is applicable to various semiconductor structures, including capacitors, MOS transistors, pixels for light detecting arrays, and electrooptic applications. The use of a germanium buffer layer allows the integration of Pb/Bi-containing ferroelectrics on GaAs substrates, which is difficult due to the instability of GaAs in O2 at normal growth temperatures. The invention provides a structure with good dielectric constants, even with fine-grained and relatively low-fired materials, and can be used to fabricate non-volatile, non-destructive readout memory cells and other semiconductor devices.</summary>

<summary>
The invention aims to provide a receiver input circuit that eliminates undesired signal actuation of non-linear components, resulting in distortions, while maintaining small signal behavior and using conventional components. The circuit includes a control loop for amplification control, with the control signal derived from the intermediate frequency signal and supplied to the part of the circuit preceding the mixer stage. A second amplification control loop is used to prevent overloading of the mixer stage and varactor diodes, while a third control loop has a lower response threshold and frequency band width. The circuit also includes a PIN diode control network that controls the amplification by distributing the operating current to the PIN diode and a shunt resistor. The PIN diode control network has the advantage of protecting the distortion-forming circuit components from signal overloading and high-voltage discharge surges from the antenna. The circuit can be further developed to include a tunable selective circuit with elements connected between the terminal and the signal input terminal, which has higher selectivity while avoiding strong attenuation of the tunable selective circuit during control. The invention also includes embodiments for the iteration-free alignment of the tunable tuning circuits and the common tuning of a two-circuit filter with a twin varactor diode.</summary>

<summary>

The invention relates to a system for setting up a collaborative work-sharing environment between physically distant individuals. The system uses a telephone and a desktop PC connected to a LAN, with a collaboration control program running on the PC. The program communicates with the phone to control a collaborate indicator and sense actuation of a collaborate button. The indicator signals to the user that the party has the capability of collaborating with the user. The user can operate the collaborate button to run a collaboration application. The system determines if the parties share a collaboration application program in common and illuminates the indicator if they do. The indicator remains illuminated as long as at least one other party remains in the call with the capability to collaborate. The collaborate button takes no action unless the indicator is lit, and launches or brings the collaboration application to the foreground if selected. The system can be implemented on top of dedicated telephone systems or data networks, and can be deployed in a peer-to-peer architecture. The invention can be implemented by a computer program operating on a computer, and encompasses a computer program and any form of carrier medium that can carry the program.

</summary>

<summary>
The invention relates to the insertion of advertising clips into a video sequence to optimize the visual impact on the spectator. The method involves generating a salience map representing the salience of the video sequence before the insertion point and a salience map for each advertising clip. A degree of similarity is then determined between the salience map of the video sequence and the salience map of each advertising clip. The advertising clip with the highest degree of similarity is selected and inserted into the video sequence at the insertion point. The insertion point is preferably a point of the video sequence corresponding to a shot change. The device for processing pictures implements the method and comprises a processing unit, a random access memory, a read-only memory, an input/output interface, and a man-machine interface.</summary>

<summary>
The invention provides a recessed mask structure to prevent localized high electrical fields at intersections in very small dimension semiconductor devices, resulting in lower electrical breakdown and improved device performance. The recessed mask structure is achieved by removing mask material between conductive regions after chemical-mechanical polishing, allowing for a lower and predictable overall capacitance and faster signal propagation in interconnect wiring.</summary>

<summary>
The invention is a downconverting digitizer that utilizes predictive coding principles to implement a simple downconverting A/D converter. The digitizer consists of a digitally-controlled variable gain amplifier, a gain control logic element, an analog summing element, a sampling element, a predictive digital filter, an offset nuller element, a digital summing element, a digital-to-analog converter, and a digital quadrature mixer. The predictive filter element is implemented using digital signal processing techniques and is designed to generate a prediction of the modulated IF signal at the next sampling epoch. The digitizer has several advantages, including the ability to confine quantization noise to a narrower bandwidth, reduce the distortion caused by interfering signals, and increase the precision of the digital representation of the signal. The invention was implemented and verified as part of a wireless telephone receiver and achieved a dynamic range of more than 52 dB without the effect of the AGC loop and more than 124 dB with the AGC loop.</summary>

<summary>
The invention relates to a method for fabricating arrays of nano-scale features on a single wafer to form a sensor device or a matrix of devices for multiplex detection of selected analytes. The method uses nanoimprint lithography to define groups of semiconducting nanotraces between electrodes, which can be used as sensors or for multiplex detection of analytes. The fabrication process involves depositing a semiconducting active layer over the entire wafer, patterning the layer into a set of parallel nanotraces using nanoimprint lithography, and depositing a drain electrode layer. The set of parallel nanotraces is perpendicular to the interdigitated finger region of the source and drain electrodes, and the dimensions of each nanotrace are critical for increasing the response sensitivity to a level that provides practical direct electrical transduction of target molecule binding. The multiplex detection array is then functionalized with a sensitizing compound, such as a nucleic acid sequence, which is covalently attached to the surface of the semiconductor nanotraces. The presence of target molecules is detected by measuring changes in the source-drain electrical current, which is indicative of the concentration of target, nature of the surface interaction, local electric field, and properties of the semiconductor nanotraces.</summary>

<summary>

The present invention relates to a singulation and plating method for semiconductor packages. The method involves providing a plurality of semiconductor dies coupled to a single common leadframe, singulating the dies, and plating the exposed side surfaces of the leads with a plating material. The plating material is preferably a material configured not to react with oxygen, such as tin, silver, gold, nickel-gold, nickel-palladium, or nickel-palladium-gold. The singulation process can be performed using full cutting or partial cutting, and the plating process can be performed before or after the singulation process. The side surfaces of the semiconductor package can be formed with a step or a beveled surface, depending on the cutting blade used. The present invention provides a new, useful, and non-obvious method of singulating and plating semiconductor packages.

</summary>

<summary>
The invention is a method and system for a mobile terminal to selectively connect to a wireless wide area network (WWAN) and a wireless local area network (WLAN). The mobile terminal has a first network module for connecting to the WWAN and a second network module for connecting to the WLAN. When the mobile terminal connects to the WLAN, the second network module turns on and the first network module turns off. The second network module receives service information from the second base station, which includes signal strength, channel information, and base station identity codes of the first base stations. The second network module then passes the service information to the first network module, which selects a serving base station according to the service information. If the first network module fails to connect to the serving base station, it can scan the frequency channels or start an all channels scanning procedure. The invention allows the mobile terminal to switch from WLAN to WWAN in time to avoid dropping or delaying connections. The method can be used in various statuses of the mobile terminal, such as "call set up", "idle", or even in a calling status.</summary>

<summary>
The invention is a new process for producing multilayered components, such as capacitors, coils, and resistors, which simplifies the manufacturing process by eliminating several costly steps. The process involves depositing electrodes and electrical components onto flexible decals, which are then stacked and fired to form the final product. The electrodes are embedded in the electrical components, eliminating the need for cutting and reducing the risk of internal delamination. This process allows for the production of smaller parts, lower voltage ratings, and a variety of tab configurations without extra process time. The invention also enables the provision of a line of capacitors adapted to use with semi-conductor devices and is adaptable to other electronic ceramic devices, such as multilayer ferrite inductors.</summary>

<summary>The present disclosure sets forth a hierarchical lattice structure that comprises unit cells of various sizes connected together to form a lightweight lattice structure with improved specific stiffness and strength. The lattice structure can be used in various applications, including sandwich panels, armors, load-bearing structures, and heat exchange systems, and can be manufactured using various methods, including injection molding, investment casting, and metal textile lay-up techniques.</summary>

<summary>
The invention relates to a process for co-producing power and hydrocarbons, which includes a wet gasification stage and a dry gasification stage. In the wet gasification stage, coal is gasified to produce a combustion gas with a high hydrogen content, while in the dry gasification stage, coal is gasified to produce a synthesis gas precursor with a lower hydrogen content. The combustion gas is enriched with hydrogen to increase its hydrogen-to-carbon monoxide ratio, and then mixed with the synthesis gas precursor to produce a synthesis gas suitable for hydrocarbon synthesis. The process also includes a Fischer-Tropsch hydrocarbon synthesis stage, where the synthesis gas is converted to hydrocarbons. The invention provides an integrated IGCC power plant and CTL plant that benefits from optimal economies of scale and provides for CO2 sequestration. The integration of the two facilities allows for the capture of CO2 from the off-gas of the IGCC facility and the use of fuel gas produced by the CTL facility as fuel in the IGCC facility.</summary>

<summary>
The present invention relates to a method for preparing a solid device for use as an oxide superconducting material. The invention aims to provide a highly reliable surface utilizing-device by preventing the removal of oxygen from the surface or portion close to the surface of the oxide superconducting material. A blocking film or passivation film is uniformly coated over the spaces or micro-holes in the surface portion of the superconducting material to prevent oxygen removal. The film is formed using a photo-CVD method, and oxygen is added to the surface or portion close to the surface by ion injection or hot oxidation. The oxygen concentration in the region at the surface or close to it can be controlled by solid phase to solid phase diffusion of the oxygen in the film. The films used for this purpose may be insulating films such as silicon nitride, aluminum nitride, or oxidized metals. The invention can be used to create a Josephson element structure or a passivation film to prevent deterioration. The method is effective in maintaining the superconductive state of the surface with long-term stability and high reliability.</summary>

<summary>
The present invention relates to an apparatus for preparing foam sheet samples for microscopic examination. The apparatus allows for the precise measurement of laboratory foam sheet cross-sectional specimens. Foam sheet stock is difficult to cut due to its thin thickness and delicate cell structure, making it imperative to use a thin cutting blade such as a razor blade. The apparatus includes a base structure, a clamping arrangement, and a screw thread specimen advance mechanism to prepare repetitive samples with uniform thickness and parallel cut edges. The apparatus is used to cut a foam sample into a series of parallel slices, each 0.004 inch thick, which can be mounted on a microscope slide for examination. The method preserves the structure of the individual cells within the sample, allowing for even transmission of light during microscopic examination. The apparatus provides a means to prepare foam samples for various physical tests, such as tensile, stretch, elongation, solvent resistance, and surface cell size, to establish performance criteria and gain insights into the differences between foam materials.</summary>

<summary>
The invention is a method and apparatus for determining the angle of inclination with respect to the vertical assumed by a seismometer, especially those designed to operate on the ocean floor. The seismometer has a seismic motion detector, such as a geophone, suspended at the end of a shaft protruding from a ball rotating in an annular seat. A spring-loaded plunger is positioned above the ball and is restrained from contact with its surface by a pin connected to a linearly acting solenoid. After deployment, the solenoid is activated, causing the pin to be pulled from the plunger, which extends to contact the surface of the ball, locking the detector in its position. The angle of inclination can be determined by measuring the acute angle formed by the ball, shaft, and detector in their locked position and a surface known to be vertical. The invention also provides a simple and inexpensive apparatus for self-leveling the seismic motion detectors used in a seismometer, especially designed to operate on the ocean floor.</summary>

<summary>
The present invention is a relative humidity sensing element that uses a combination of capacitance and resistance to measure humidity levels in the atmosphere. The element consists of a first electron conductive electrode, a porous coating of dielectric, minute particles of electron conductive material deposited in the interstices of the porosity, and a second electron conductive electrode pervious to moisture vapor. The element is manufactured by anodizing a commercially pure aluminum electrode, depositing nickel particles into the anodized layer, and then sealing and overlaying the layer with a porous vacuum deposition of nickel to form the second electrode. The element is suitable for excitation by a low-voltage alternating current voltage and has a response time of approximately one second. The impedance between the electrodes varies generally linearly with relation to the relative humidity of the surrounding gaseous atmosphere in a suitable range of interest.</summary>

<summary>
The invention provides a motor assembly with a force transmission structure that includes a drive plate and a shaft. The drive plate has a Y-shaped mounting hole and the shaft has a Y-shaped toothed portion that fits into the mounting hole, allowing for stable rotation and quiet operation. The drive plate is preferably made of an engineering plastics material and the shaft is made of low alloy steel, with the drive plate's buffer holes aiding in molding and reducing distortion.</summary>

<summary>
The present invention provides a method and system for generating a mobile time reference for a portable transceiver in a WCDMA system. The system includes a free running counter that uses a high frequency oscillator and a low frequency oscillator to generate and maintain the mobile time reference. The free running counter operates in two time domains, 30.72 MHz and 32 KHz, depending on whether the portable transceiver is in active mode or idle mode. The mobile time reference is used to detect, identify, and monitor multipath signals, and its accuracy is maintained to 32 nanoseconds. The system also includes a multipath monitor and a multipath radio signal recovery circuit to recover and track incoming clock information and provide phase estimation for single and multiple basestation antennas.</summary>

<summary>
The existing protective helmets have hard outer shells and a resilient liner assembly to absorb shock, but they often require adjustable straps and can be cumbersome to fit. Previous methods of making custom-fitted helmets have limitations, such as the need for direct handling of foaming agents or complex preformed liners. The invention described in the text proposes a helmet liner with a plurality of layers, each consisting of an elastic thermoplastic sheet formed with an array of pockets, which can be fitted to an individual's head by heating and deforming the sheets. This design allows for a simple and rapid fitting process, and the liner can be refitted to accommodate a changed head size without the need for drawstrings or trimming.</summary>

<summary>The invention is a multiorifice structure, specifically a wafer, comprising alternating concentric layers of solid rods and cylindrical members fused or sintered into an integral assembly. The structure has a plurality of angularly disposed passages, with the angles of the passageways increasing progressively as a function of their distance from the center of the structure, allowing for effective atomization of a fluid.</summary>

<summary>

The invention relates to a method of manufacturing a semiconductor device, particularly an insulated gate (MOS) field effect semiconductor device with a lightly doped drain (LDD) structure. The conventional LDD structure has several problems, including difficulty in determining the time to terminate anisotropic reactive ion etching (RIE) and the formation of a crystalline structure that requires high temperature annealing. The invention aims to improve the controllability of the width of the oxide portion on the gate sidewall and to provide a method of manufacturing a semiconductor device in which an LDD structure can be formed by a low temperature process. According to the invention, an insulating film is formed on the gate electrode, and a layer is deposited on the insulating film and anisotropically etched away using RIE, except a portion thereof on the gate sidewall. The width of the oxide portion on the gate sidewall is determined by the thickness of the gate electrode. The invention also includes various embodiments, such as forming a conductive layer on the insulating film on the gate electrode and anisotropically etching it to form a portion on the gate sidewall. The conductive layer portion on the gate sidewall can be formed by depositing a high melting point metal or a silicide of such a metal.
