<summary>
The episode begins with the aftermath of Luke's merge with Kai, where Kai has won and Luke is gone. Caroline's mother, Liz, has passed away, and Caroline is struggling to cope with her loss. Damon is tasked with writing Liz's eulogy, but is struggling to find the right words. Meanwhile, Bonnie is trying to find a way to escape the 1994 prison world, and Jo is dealing with the consequences of Kai's failed merge with her magic. As the episode progresses, Caroline's emotional state deteriorates, and she ultimately decides to turn off her humanity to cope with her grief. The episode ends with Caroline killing Elena, and Stefan searching for her, while Damon discovers a mysterious woman in a video from Bonnie's camera, who appears to be his mother.</summary>

<summary>
Veronica Mars is dealing with her recent breakup with Logan and trying to focus on her cases. Her father, Keith, is investigating the possible murder of Dean O'Dell, who was found dead with a note that read "Goodbye, cruel world." Veronica and her friends Mac and Parker get involved in the case and also start to investigate the theft of a genetically altered monkey from a lab. They discover that the monkey's research was being sabotaged and that the lab's computer was destroyed. Veronica also gets involved with the People for Humane Animal Treatment (PHAT) group, who are fighting against animal cruelty on campus. Meanwhile, Logan is trying to move on from his breakup with Veronica and starts to hang out with a new group of people, including Taylor. Veronica eventually discovers that Gil Thomas, one of the lab scientists, was behind the theft of the monkey and the sabotage of the lab's computer, and she also uncovers a plot by PHAT to steal the monkey and use it for their own purposes.</summary>

<summary>
Ryan is recovering from being shot and Annie is by his side, trying to keep him calm and focused on his recovery. Meanwhile, Kendall and Zach are dealing with the aftermath of Hannah's attempt to kill Josh, and Zach is determined to find her and make her pay for her actions. J.R. is struggling with his father's attempts to manipulate him and is seeking advice from Tad. Babe is trying to navigate her feelings for Richie and J.R., and is seeking guidance from her mother, Krystal. Dre is hiding out in the Chandler Mansion tunnels after running away from his father's expectations, and Colby is trying to help him. As the story unfolds, alliances are formed and broken, and secrets are revealed that threaten to destroy relationships and lives.</summary>

<summary>
The scene begins with Amanda and J.R. discussing their relationship and a possible ghost in the house. Meanwhile, Reese is dealing with a hangover and regrets from the previous night. Bianca and Reese are getting married, but their families are dealing with their own issues. Kendall is upset about Reese and Bianca staying in Pine Valley, and Zach is trying to calm her down. Greenlee is feeling unwell and decides to call off the wedding, but Ryan is determined to go through with it. Annie is struggling with her own issues and tries to stop Ryan from marrying Greenlee. The wedding ceremony begins, but it's interrupted by Annie's arrival and a confrontation with Ryan. In the end, Bianca and Reese get married, and Greenlee flies off her motorcycle to avoid Kendall's car.</summary>

<summary>
Greenlee is missing after her motorcycle crashed on the way to her wedding, and her fiancé Ryan is desperate to find her. As the search continues, secrets and lies are revealed, including an affair between Zach and Reese, which may have contributed to the accident. Meanwhile, Annie is accused of killing Greenlee, but she claims she didn't do it, and Aidan is nowhere to be found to corroborate her alibi.</summary>

<summary>
Tad discovers a website called "datermater.com" and teases Jake about his online dating profile. Meanwhile, other characters deal with their own personal issues, including Amanda, who is struggling to care for her unborn child after being fired from her job. J.R. tries to convince Amanda to sign over custody of the baby, but she refuses. Adam is offered a chance to work with Erica to turn around Fusion, but he is hesitant. David and Krystal get married, but their union is complicated by David's past and his relationship with his daughter, Babe. Amanda finds herself in a difficult situation and is forced to accept help from Jake and Tad. As the day comes to a close, David and Krystal exchange their vows and are pronounced husband and wife. The episode ends with Amanda experiencing complications with her pregnancy and J.R. struggling with his own personal demons.</summary>

<summary>
Erica and Chris's relationship is put to the test as Erica reveals she has been cheating on Chris with Enchantment. Chris is torn between his love for Erica and his doubts about her infidelity. Adam Chandler is searching for his missing son JR, who has been avoiding his friends and family. Laurie, JR's girlfriend, is struggling with her own feelings and is considering attending college without JR's financial support. Tad is trying to navigate his feelings for Liza, who has kissed him, and is also developing a connection with Lysistrata, a therapist. Simone is trying to get the public to notice Fusion, but her methods are questionable. Mia is trying to get answers from Alison about her relationship with Jake, who left her without explanation. The relationships and alliances in Pine Valley are complex and multifaceted, with many characters struggling with their own desires and motivations.</summary>

<summary>
The story revolves around the lives of several characters in the town, including David and Krystal's fight for custody of their grandson, J.R.'s struggles with the law, and the complicated relationships between Kendall, Zach, and Ryan. Meanwhile, Opal and Jack deal with the aftermath of Greenlee's death, and Jesse finds a new home for Little A, Krystal and David's grandson, with him and Angie.

</summary>

<summary>
Erica Kane confronts Ethan Cambias about his relationship with her daughter Kendall, accusing him of lying about Zach Slater's innocence. Ethan insists that he loves Kendall and wants to marry her, but Erica is skeptical. Meanwhile, Ryan Lavery returns to Pine Valley and confronts his former teacher, Mr. Hewlett, about his past abuse. Braden Lavery, Ryan's brother, is revealed to be the killer of Edmund Grey, and Lily Montgomery's testimony is crucial to the case. Ethan's lies are exposed, and Kendall is devastated. As the police close in on Braden, Kendall becomes increasingly unhinged, refusing to accept the truth about Ethan's deception. Zach Slater's lawyer, Livia, agrees to take his case, and Ethan's father, Arthur, is informed about Erica's opposition to their relationship. The story concludes with a sense of urgency and danger, as the characters navigate the consequences of their actions.</summary>

<summary>
Annie is struggling with her memories and is convinced that her friend Tori is real, but Aidan believes she created Tori as a way to cope with her past. Meanwhile, Adam Chandler is back in town and is trying to keep his health issues a secret, while his son J.R. is dealing with the aftermath of Adam's kidnapping charges. David Hayward is also trying to find Adam and is working with the police to have him arrested. In other storylines, Ian is recovering from open-heart surgery, and Kendall is worried about her son's health. Reese is trying to make amends with Bianca, but Ryan is skeptical of her intentions. As the storylines continue to unfold, secrets and lies are revealed, and alliances are tested.</summary>

<summary>
Angie and Jesse are celebrating their unconventional wedding in a hotel room, but their romantic evening is interrupted by a fire alarm and a wedding reception across the courtyard. Meanwhile, Erica Kane is producing a reality TV show and has recruited Carmen and Louisa to star in it, with the promise of a new beginning and a chance to tell their story. Ryan and Greenlee have a heart-to-heart conversation, and Greenlee ultimately decides to leave Ryan and return to Aidan. As the night unfolds, various characters navigate their relationships, secrets, and personal struggles, including Annie's decision to file for divorce from Ryan and Kendall's efforts to help Aidan win Greenlee back.</summary>

<summary>
Ryan and Annie discuss their marriage and whether it's time to move on, with Ryan expressing a desire to hold off on the divorce and give their marriage more time. Meanwhile, Greenlee tries to win back Aidan's heart with the help of Zach, who initially seems opposed to the idea but eventually comes around. Erica Kane uses her celebrity status to advocate for Carmen's release from prison, while Jesse reflects on his past friendship with Jenny and the challenges they faced. The episode also features various other storylines, including Kendall's guilt over sleeping with Aidan and Jesse's eulogy for Jenny, which highlights the enduring power of love.</summary>

<summary>
A wedding reception turns deadly when Robert Gardner, a retired FBI agent, takes Angie Hubbard hostage and starts shooting at the guests. Jesse Hubbard, Angie's husband, and Frankie Hubbard, her son, work together to save her and the other hostages. Meanwhile, Julia, a pregnant woman, is shot and rushed to the hospital, where she eventually dies from her injuries. Tad Martin is also injured in the chaos and is taken to the hospital by Frankie and Jake. As the story unfolds, secrets and lies are revealed, including a past affair between Aidan and Kendall, which has devastating consequences for Greenlee.</summary>

<summary>
Kendall is being held captive by Ricky, who is revealed to be the killer of Zach and Diana Holden. Griffin, who is presumed dead, returns and helps Kendall and the police to catch Ricky, but is then arrested for outstanding warrants. In the end, Griffin is released and Kendall is grateful for his help in bringing Ricky to justice and clearing his name.</summary>

<summary>
The story revolves around the lives of several characters in Pine Valley, including Tad Martin, who has been reunited with his long-lost daughter Kate, and Adam Chandler, who has been trying to make amends for his past mistakes. Meanwhile, Ryan Lavery struggles to come to terms with his past and his feelings for Greenlee, while Annie Lavery tries to conceive a child with the help of Dr. Campbell. As the characters navigate their personal struggles, they also face challenges and conflicts with each other, including Adam's feud with Tad and J.R.'s anger towards his father, Adam Chandler.
</summary>

<summary>
The story revolves around various characters dealing with their personal struggles and relationships, including J.R. and Babe's marriage issues, Jamie's involvement with a drug dealer, and David's attempt to connect with his daughter Babe. Meanwhile, Kendall tries to manipulate Ryan and Greenlee's marriage for her own gain, and Bobby is offered a job by Kendall to seduce Greenlee.

</summary>

<summary>
Annie is excited about planning her wedding to Scott Chandler, but he wants to give her the wedding of her dreams. Meanwhile, Marissa is struggling with her failed bar exam and her troubled marriage to J.R. Greenlee is dealing with her past relationship with Ryan and her current relationship with David. Caleb Cooney is trying to help Marissa and is also involved in a rivalry with the Chandler family. Ryan is trying to help his daughter Emma find her lost Cinderella dress, which was given to her by Greenlee. In the end, Greenlee helps Emma find a new dress and makes amends with Ryan, while J.R. closes a big deal and celebrates with Annie. David becomes increasingly possessive and jealous of Ryan's interactions with Greenlee, leading to a confrontation between the two men.</summary>

<summary>
Taylor visits Dr. Jake Martin to get his foot checked out, but Jake is distracted by his personal life and his attraction to Taylor. Meanwhile, J.R. tries to convince Babe to let him buy Fusion, the company she co-founded with her friends, so that she can run it and be happy. Adam and Barry are secretly plotting to take down Fusion and its leaders, Kendall and Greenlee. Randi, a new employee at Fusion, is hesitant to participate in a modeling campaign and is being blackmailed by Fletcher, who is threatening to harm her family. As the story unfolds, various characters' personal lives and relationships are revealed, including Jake's past and his connection to Taylor, and J.R.'s efforts to win back Babe's trust and prove himself as a changed man.</summary>

<summary>
The scenes depict various characters dealing with their personal struggles and relationships, including Jamie and Amanda's complicated past with Babe, Ryan's attempts to reconnect with his loved ones while staying dead, and Julia's efforts to reconnect with her godson Sam after being in witness protection. Meanwhile, Tad tries to convince Di to reveal information about Kevin Sturgess, who is involved in a crime syndicate, and Greenlee tries to prepare Kendall for motherhood while dealing with her own feelings about Ryan's supposed death. Throughout the scenes, characters navigate their emotions, relationships, and past traumas, often leading to tense and dramatic moments.
</summary>

<summary>
The story revolves around the aftermath of David Hayward's death, with various characters dealing with the consequences of his actions and the events that led to his demise. Greenlee Hayward is forced to confront her own role in David's death, including her involvement in the plane crash that killed Erica Kane's sister, and her husband's subsequent blackmail. Meanwhile, Ryan Lavery is facing murder charges for David's death, and his loved ones are rallying around him, including Madison, who is determined to stand by him despite the risks. As the truth about David's death begins to unravel, the characters must come to terms with their own actions and the impact they have had on those around them.</summary>

<summary>
J.R. is trying to find his missing mother, Dixie, and enlists the help of Babe and others to locate her. Meanwhile, Julia and Di are being held captive by Garret, who is trying to get a letter from Di that incriminates him. Greenlee visits Erin, who is struggling to cope with the loss of her brother Ryan, and tries to help her understand Ryan's character. Adam tries to make amends with Krystal, but she is not interested in reconciliation. Tad and Zach are investigating Garret's involvement in Julia's disappearance and try to get Mimi to question her husband. Julia and Di come up with a plan to take down Garret when he returns, but Di is hesitant to get involved in violence. J.R. and Adam try to regain control of Chandler Enterprises, but their efforts are complicated by Adam's marriage to Krystal. As the story unfolds, alliances are formed and broken, and the characters are drawn deeper into a web of deceit and danger.</summary>

<summary>
Bianca confronts her mother Erica about J.R.'s version of Babe's letter, which claims that Bess is Miranda. Erica reveals that Babe said she would never leave Bess, but she did, and that Babe's letter is full of lies. Bianca is furious and feels lied to, but Erica tries to reassure her that the DNA test proves Bess is not her daughter. Meanwhile, J.R. tries to convince Tad to keep Jamie's location a secret to protect him from Adam, who wants to use Jamie to get to Colby. Tad is torn between his loyalty to J.R. and his desire to do what's right. Kendall is accused of killing Ryan, but it's later revealed that Greenlee tried to kill her. Ryan returns and tries to comfort Greenlee, who is struggling with the aftermath of her actions. Ethan's charges are dismissed when it's revealed that there's another shooter, and Zach is suspected of being the one who shot at Ryan.

</summary>

<summary>
The scene takes place at a fundraiser in Pine Valley, where various characters are attending to support the town's recovery from tornados. Erica Kane is hosting the event and announces a dance auction, which David Hayward wins with a bid of $50,000. Meanwhile, Annie Lavery, Ryan's ex-wife, is planning to get married to Ryan at the party, and she has a bloody knife with her. As the night unfolds, Annie's true intentions are revealed, and she attempts to harm Erica, who is found motionless on the floor of the ladies' room. The scene ends with Ryan trying to protect Annie and asking her who she hurt with the knife.

</summary>

<summary>
The scene begins with Erin running in the park, but she trips and falls. Erica and Tad discuss Dr. Greg Madden, who is at the center of a controversy involving Kendall and Greenlee. Kendall is carrying a baby for Greenlee, but the truth has been revealed, causing tension between the two women and their loved ones. Ryan tries to win Greenlee back, but she rejects him, feeling that their relationship is over. Meanwhile, Jack and Erica try to navigate their marriage and deal with the fallout from the controversy. Ultimately, the scene ends with several characters in a state of emotional turmoil, including Greenlee, Ryan, and Kendall, who are all struggling to come to terms with the consequences of their actions.</summary>

<summary>
Aaron and Alison are reminiscing about their time together, but Aaron's injury is still a concern. Meanwhile, Will is dealing with the aftermath of being accused of torturing Rosanna, and Emily is being accused of setting him up. Emily insists she's innocent and wants to take a polygraph test to clear her name. As the story unfolds, it's revealed that Emily's sister, Alison, is skeptical of her claims, and Aaron is trying to be supportive. The plot thickens as Emily's husband, Hal, is torn between believing her and the evidence against her. Ultimately, Emily decides to take the polygraph test to prove her innocence, but the outcome is uncertain.</summary>

<summary>
Casey returns home after being released from jail and is welcomed by his family and friends. However, he struggles to adjust to life outside and feels like he's standing still while everyone else is moving on. Meanwhile, Parker is dealing with anger issues and a fear of abandonment, and his parents, Carly and Jack, are working with a therapist to help him. Brad is recovering from a broken leg and is trying to win Katie back by telling her how he feels, but she keeps pushing him away. Barbara reveals to Will and Gwen that she has cancer, and Carly is struggling to come to terms with her sister Rosanna's departure. Casey finds a job at his grandmother's restaurant, and Jack is trying to be more supportive of Parker's therapy. As the characters navigate their personal struggles, they also face challenges and surprises, including Brad's confession to Katie and Carly's conversation with Sam about their shared losses.</summary>

<summary>

Casey Hughes is getting married to Alison Stewart the next day, but he's nervous about it. Mick Dante, who claims to be the ghost of James Stenbeck, has escaped from the hospital and is causing trouble. Alison's sister Emily and her mother Susan are worried about Alison's safety and try to find her. Paul, who was betrayed by James Stenbeck, is also searching for Mick and wants to kill him. Mick is struggling with his identity and the programming that James Stenbeck put in his head. He wants Alison to come away with him and leave her fiancé Casey behind. Alison is torn between her love for Casey and her feelings for Mick. Paul discovers that Mick is actually James Stenbeck and plans to kill him. Casey and Alison are getting ready for their wedding, but Alison is still unsure about her feelings for Mick. In the end, Mick is determined to make Alison choose between him and Casey.

</summary>

<summary>
The characters are celebrating Valentine's Day, with various romantic and family moments unfolding throughout the scenes. Meanwhile, Paul, who was presumed dead, is secretly alive and trying to reconnect with Jennifer, while also dealing with the consequences of his past actions. Other storylines involve Maddie helping Will and Gwen evade the law, and Holden and Lily discovering they are having another baby.

</summary>

<summary>
Mick Dante, a man with a split personality, takes Casey and Alison hostage in a church, demanding to play a twisted game of truth or dare. As the situation unfolds, it becomes clear that Mick is a clone of James Stenbeck, a manipulative and controlling figure from the past. Alison's past infidelity with Mick is revealed, causing tension between her and Casey. Meanwhile, Margo, Casey's mother, tries to find a way to rescue her son and the other hostages. In a dramatic turn of events, Paul, Emily's fiancé, declares his love for Emily and convinces her to start a new life together. Ultimately, Mick is shot by Casey, and Alison chooses to be with Mick, who has finally broken free from James' control.</summary>

<summary>
Brad and Katie are trying to conceive a baby, and they enlist the help of their friends Henry and Vienna. Meanwhile, Luke is struggling with his foundation and his identity, and he eventually decides to return to work and make amends with his past. Lucinda, Luke's grandmother, is dealing with her own health issues and tries to get Luke to take over the foundation. Ultimately, Luke finds a new sense of purpose and direction, and he and his friends come together to celebrate their new beginnings.
</summary>

<summary>
Jennifer is struggling to balance her work and pregnancy, and her mother Barbara offers to help with the wedding planning. Meanwhile, Will and Alison's friendship is put to the test as Alison realizes she has feelings for Aaron, and Will is hurt by her decision to end their friendship. Holden is concerned about Keith's presence in Lily's life, but Lily is trying to move on from her marriage and have fun with Keith. Keith is dealing with his own issues, including a debt collector who is threatening him. The episode ends with a cliffhanger as Lily screams for help after a gunshot is heard.</summary>

<summary>
Katie and Brad are expecting a baby, and they are going to be on a reality TV show about trying to get pregnant. However, their friends Henry and Vienna, who were also on the show, are hesitant to participate again due to their past experience of losing a baby. Vienna decides to go on the show to support Katie, but Henry is still upset and feels left out. Meanwhile, Paul and Rosanna are on the run with Paul's baby, Eliza, after being accused of kidnapping. They stop at a diner and meet a kind owner, Mr. Kent, who helps them out. As the story unfolds, Katie is hospitalized due to high blood pressure, and Brad and Vienna take over her role on the TV show. Vienna and Brad start to develop a close relationship, which causes tension between Vienna and her boyfriend, Henry.</summary>

<summary>
Bonnie and Dusty have a conversation about a personal item that Bonnie left in Dusty's car, and they discuss a past incident that Bonnie doesn't remember. Meg is dealing with her daughter Eliza's father, Paul, and is considering giving him more visitation rights. Damian offers his support for Meg's decision, but Dusty is opposed to it. Carly is struggling with her son Parker and her feelings for Craig, who is trying to help her. Rosanna is staying with Paul at Fairwinds and is considering getting a job to be independent. Paul is trying to help Rosanna get her money back from Craig, but she is hesitant. Craig is trying to make amends with Rosanna and Carly, but they are both wary of his intentions. Dusty and Meg have a heart-to-heart conversation about their relationship and Dusty's feelings for her. In the end, Meg decides to go through with the custody agreement that gives Paul more visitation rights, despite Dusty's objections.</summary>

<summary>
Carly and Jack are getting married in a beautiful outdoor ceremony in Montana, surrounded by their friends and family, but the day is filled with moments of tension and drama as they deal with past mistakes and unresolved issues. Meanwhile, Holden and Dusty are searching for Lily and Rose, who are trapped in a well, and they finally get a lead on their location after talking to Susan, who remembers a hunting lodge where the twins might be held captive.</summary>

<summary>
Lily has a nightmare about Ethan being trapped in a hole, but Holden reassures her it was just a dream. The family is concerned about Ethan's safety after he was trapped in a hole, and they are waiting for the rescue team to get him out. Meanwhile, Henry is being held captive by Derek, who is working for James Stenbeck. Henry's friends, Vienna and Bonnie, are also being held captive and are trying to survive. Paul is trapped in the hole with Ethan and is trying to get him out. The rescue team is working to get Paul and Ethan out of the hole, but they are facing challenges. Meg is worried about Paul and is trying to get him out of the hole. James Stenbeck reveals that he is behind the kidnapping and is trying to get an heir to inherit his empire. In the end, Paul is killed in the hole, and James takes Meg's unborn child as his heir.</summary>

<summary>
Janet is worried about her daughter Liberty, who has gone missing after a disagreement about Liberty's pregnancy. Liberty had spent the night at a friend's house, but her mother is still concerned. Liberty's boyfriend Paul and his partner Emily have offered to adopt Liberty's baby, but Janet is opposed to the idea. Liberty decides to move in with Emily and Paul, causing tension between her and her mother. Meanwhile, Adam's hearing is taking place, and his brother Casey is trying to get Maddie to testify on his behalf. Maddie ultimately decides not to testify, but Casey convinces her to change her mind. Adam's charges are eventually dropped, and he is released from custody. However, Adam decides to leave town, causing his family to be upset and confused.</summary>

<summary>
The characters in the story are dealing with various personal struggles and relationships, including Carly's terminal illness, Noah's father accepting his son's gay relationship, and Rosanna's complicated past with Paul and Craig. Meanwhile, Parker tries to find a way to save his mother's life, and Dusty is trying to get help from his friend Lily Snyder after being shot by Colonel Mayer.

</summary>

<summary>
Chris Hughes returns to Oakdale and reunites with his girlfriend Emily, and they discuss his plans to work on a research project with Evan Walsh, a biochemist. Meanwhile, Jack and Carly are planning their wedding, despite Jack's initial reservations and the fact that Carly is terminally ill. As the story unfolds, Chris's father, Bob, is resistant to Chris's ideas, and Chris's relationships with his family are explored, particularly his complicated relationship with his father.</summary>

<summary>
Liam is waiting for Steffy to arrive at a dinner party, but she is late and he becomes frustrated, eventually deciding to leave for the airport to take a jet to get away from the situation. Meanwhile, Quinn and Ridge have a conversation about their past behavior and agree to a new understanding where they will respect each other and not reveal their secret about what happened in San Francisco. Wyatt and Steffy finalize their divorce, and Liam eventually finds out that Steffy is late because she lost track of time and had to rush to the airport to stop Liam from leaving. Steffy arrives just in time to stop Liam from leaving and they share a romantic moment, with Steffy revealing that the divorce is final and she is all his.</summary>

<summary>
Rick Forrester's relationship with Steffy Forrester is discovered by her grandmother, Stephanie, who is determined to keep them apart due to her long-standing feud with the Forrester family. Meanwhile, Bridget, who is working as the new designer for Jackie Marone's company, tries to keep her identity hidden from her family, while Taylor is dealing with her own grief over the loss of her daughter, Phoebe, and is unaware of Steffy's relationship with Rick.</summary>

<summary>
The scene begins with Nicole, Vivienne, and Maya discussing their hair and makeup for the wedding. Zende arrives and is excited to see his parents, Kristen and Tony. The guests are mingling, and Sally and Shirley are trying to get into the Forrester estate to take photos for their upcoming preview. Julius, Nicole's father, arrives and is proud to see his daughter getting married. Quinn and Eric are discussing their spot in the house, and Quinn is feeling a bit jealous. The wedding cake is being prepared, but it's not turning out as planned. Zende is feeling anxious about the wedding, but his mother, Kristen, reassures him that everything will be fine. The guests are getting ready for the ceremony, and Nicole is feeling grateful for her life and everyone in it. The "Wedding March" plays, and Nicole walks down the aisle to marry Zende. Carter officiates the ceremony, and the guests are filled with joy and happiness as the couple exchanges their vows.

</summary>

<summary>
Bill Spencer is trying to reconnect with his family after his son Thorne leaves Katie, his ex-wife, and their son Will. Bill visits Katie and Will to check on them and offer his support. Wyatt Spencer, Bill's son, is considering returning to Spencer Publications, but only if his father makes amends with Sally, his ex-girlfriend. Wyatt wants his father to revive Sally's fashion line, Spectra Fashions, which he destroyed in the past. Bill is trying to make things right with his family and is willing to do whatever it takes to reunite them. Katie is still reeling from Thorne's departure and is trying to process her feelings about her marriage and her relationship with Bill. Bill is concerned about Katie and Will's well-being and is trying to be supportive. Wyatt and Sally are discussing their future together and Wyatt is encouraging Sally to pursue her dreams in the fashion industry. Sally is touched by Wyatt's love and support and feels confident about their future together.</summary>

<summary>
Hope and Liam are trying to move forward with their relationship despite Steffy's attempts to keep them apart. Meanwhile, Brooke and Ridge are attending a dinner at Bikini with Katie and Bill, where they discuss their children's relationships and the upcoming wedding between Hope and Liam. Bill expresses his concerns about Hope's inexperience and suggests that Liam should take some time to decide what he really wants, causing tension among the group.</summary>

<summary>
Nick Newman is concerned about Taylor Marone's ability to care for their son Jack due to her history of drinking and emotional instability. He asks his lawyer Storm to file an emergency petition for custody. Brooke Logan, Taylor's friend and the biological mother of Jack, is aware of Taylor's struggles and supports Nick's decision. Taylor, however, is determined to prove herself as a capable mother and is upset by Nick's actions. She turns to Rick Forrester, Brooke's son, for support, and he agrees to help her. Meanwhile, Ridge Forrester and his sister Felicia are planning a family gathering to coincide with their parents' anniversary. Felicia is determined to keep their father from leaving their mother, Donna, and Ridge is less enthusiastic about the idea. Storm is able to arrange for an emergency hearing to be held the next day, and Nick is preparing for the possibility of losing custody of Jack. Taylor receives the court papers and is devastated, and she turns to Rick for comfort. She accuses Brooke of being behind Nick's decision and vows to fight for custody of Jack.</summary>

<summary>
Liam and Steffy are visiting Hope and her children, Kelly and Beth, and Liam is struggling with the separation from Hope and Beth. Thomas, Hope's ex-husband, is planning to marry Zoe and is rushing the wedding, which is causing tension with Hope and her son Douglas. Douglas is upset about the sudden change and is having trouble adjusting to the idea of Thomas and Zoe getting married. Thomas is trying to reassure Hope that Zoe will be a good mother to Douglas, but Hope is worried about her son's feelings. Steffy tries to comfort Liam, who is feeling guilty about his relationship with Steffy and the impact it's having on Hope and Beth. Thomas is trying to manipulate Hope into marrying him again by making her feel guilty and anxious about Douglas's well-being. Liam warns Hope that Thomas is trying to manipulate her and that she should be careful. Thomas is trying to convince Hope to take a step back and let Zoe and Douglas bond, but Hope is worried that this is just a way for Thomas to take Douglas away from her.</summary>

<summary>
Ridge and Rick are discussing a business deal, with Ridge trying to convince Rick to lower the price of a corner store. Rick accuses Ridge of manipulating him in the past, specifically over a house. Thomas and Caroline are having a conversation, with Thomas expressing his desire to be close to his younger brother and Caroline's baby. Caroline starts experiencing contractions and Thomas helps her call Ridge, who is on his way home. Eric and Rick have a conversation, with Rick expressing his anger towards Ridge for manipulating him and taking advantage of him. Rick accuses Ridge of being a master manipulator and claims that he will eventually get what's coming to him. Ridge arrives home and helps Caroline with her contractions, with Thomas and the midwife and doula assisting. Eric tries to reassure Rick that Ridge is a good person and that he will be a good father. Ridge and Caroline's baby is being born, with Ridge coaching Caroline through the process and expressing his love for her. The baby is finally born, and Ridge and Caroline share a moment of joy and love.

</summary>

<summary>
The Forrester and Spencer families are preparing to travel to Australia for Steffy and Liam's wedding. Quinn and Eric are excited to attend the wedding as a couple, and Brooke and Ridge are also looking forward to their own wedding, which will take place soon. Meanwhile, Sally is considering attending Steffy's wedding as Thomas Forrester's date, despite her initial reluctance. Thomas invites Sally to the wedding, and she eventually decides to book a flight to Australia. As the plane takes off, the family members are excited and happy to be together, but also a bit tired and ready for some rest. Bill Spencer is on the plane, and he seems to be in a good mood, but Katie notices that he's looking at Quinn with interest. As the plane takes off, the family members settle in for the long flight ahead.</summary>

<summary>
Katie, a woman with a heart transplant, is in the hospital with heart failure due to myocarditis, an inflammation of the heart muscle. Her family and friends are worried about her condition and try to figure out what happened. It is revealed that Katie had a car accident and was driving to meet her husband Bill and his friend Brooke, but they had an argument and Bill was drinking. Brooke hid Bill at her house to avoid a scandal, and Katie found out and left. The family is trying to keep the incident private, but Taylor, Katie's therapist, is suspicious and thinks that Brooke and Bill's relationship is the cause of Katie's stress.
